title: Dude keeps on losing the “Employee of the Quarter” award to his dog (10 Photos)
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
Not everyone gets the opportunity to work from home, but when you do, the perks are pretty awesome – working in your PJs, fully stocked beer fridge and you don’t need to deal with that annoying coworker who just stands in our cubicle and just won’t shut the fuck up. In the home office, you get to pick your office mates, and that’s a pretty sweet perk. That’s the situation that Michael Reegs found himself in. 
Michael runs the Accuride International Inc.’s Southeastern Sales Center, and he’s got two other teammates; Meeka and Kya. They’re the family dogs. 2 
Working remotely for the drawer slide manufacturer, Reeg relies on his dogs to keep him sane and to bounce ideas off of. This is why Meeka’s been the employee of the quarter, four times running. 
When he comes across a problem or needs to work on a sales pitch, he’ll try it out on Meeka and it’s her feedback that helps him determine which direction he should go in. 
True story. 3 
It might sound cheesy, but he looks forward to his work day because of the dogs, especially Meeka. It’s not easy to transition from working in a busy office, to getting yourself motivated to work in your quiet home. Meeka makes the workday more fun. 
Even if there’s a day he’s not in the office and is on the road instead, she’ll come into the office anyways. If the door is closed, she camps out in front of the door, just in case he’s really inside. 
It’s this behaviour that made Michael decide to liven up his home office with some “Employee of the Quarter” signs. 4 
When it comes to getting your ass in gear after waking up and walking 5 feet to the next room to get game face on and do your job, it really helps to have something to work for, to keep you sane. Which is why Meeka’s won the “Employee of the Quarter” award over Michael. 5 
The funny thing is that he’s actually shared these awards with his superiors at the corporate office of Accuride, and they fully support Reeg’s decision to give Meeka this honour. 
I mean, sure, it might be a joke and a way for a guy working from home to keep his sanity intact, but you can’t really understate the effect that a dog has on your well-being and mental health, especially when you’ve got a high stress job like corporate sales. Advertisement
